title: Common Reusable Property Definitions
description: Schema for the RISNET properties that multiple objects use

abs_height_cm.description: Absolute height of the bridge based upon the used reference level for heights.

abs_height_open_cm.description: Absolute height of the opearable object (if applicable) based upon the used reference level for heights.

berth_ref.description: RIS_ID of the Berth object this object is belonging to.

berth_refs.description: Comma separated list of RIS_IDs of the Berth object(s) that are linked (max 20 refs).

bridge_ref.description: RIS_ID of the Bridge object this object is belonging to.

cl_height_cm.description: Available height in cm based on the reference height (height_ref) of the object.

cl_height_open_cm.description: Available height in cm of the operable object in opened condition.

cl_length_cm.description: Available length in cm of the object.

cl_width_cm.description: Available width in cm of the object.

clsdng.description: Class of dangerous goods, for which the berth can be used. Allowed Values: 1 (one blue light / cone), 2 (two blue lights / cones), 3 (three blue lights / cones), 4 (no blue light / cone), 5 (one red light / red cone top down.

direction.description: Relevant direction for the object. Allowed values: UPS (upstream), DWN (downstream), ALL (all directions)

distance_mark_ref.description: Reference to a distance_mark for the object used by the voyage calculator

comex_section_ref.description: Combined code (CNTRYCODE + FW_CODE + SEQ_NR) for backwards compatibility with COMEX. In RIS COMEX RNM 2.3.1 this attribute is called CODE and is the main identifier of a fairway section (optional)

down_fairway_km.description: Fairway km of the downstream node, by which the network section is formed and connected to others.

entry_exit_distance_mark_refs.description: RIS_IDs of the distance mark objects that are the entry/exit points towards the port (comma separated). Max 20 items.

entry_exit_lock_refs.description: RIS_IDs of the locks that are the entry/exit points towards the port (comma separated). Max 20 items.

fairway_from_km.description: Fairway km indication covering the range (start) of the object along the fairway.

fairway_km.description: Fairway kilometer indication, to serve as landmark assisting orientation rather than as basis for distance calculations

fairway_ref.description: Reference to the most important river/canal associated with the object.

fairway_section_code.description: The Fairway Section Code has to be assigned by the national authorities. It represents the coding of a waterway section within a national network and is only unique in combination with the country code.

fairway_to_km.description: Fairway km indication covering the range (end) of the object along the fairway. Can be omitted if equal to fairway_from_km.

gauge_ref.description: RIS_ID of the reference gauge station, providing water level information for the calculation of actual clearance height.

harbour_basin_ref.description: RIS_ID of the Harbour basin object the object is belonging to.

harbour_ref.description: RIS_ID of the Harbour object the object is belonging to.

height_ref_level_name.description: Code of the Reference Height, from which the clearance height is measured. The reference height is based on the zero point of the gauge (ZPG) specified in the Gauge object.

lock_basin_ref.description: RIS_ID of the related lock basin if the object belongs to a lock basin.

lock_ref.description: RIS_ID of the Lock object the object is belonging to.

max_draught_cm.description: Maximum allowed draught of the vessel in cm. This shall be a fall-back default value for all ship categories, if no Sailing Dimensions table is provided.

max_height_cm.description: Maximum allowed height of the vessel in cm.

max_height_open_cm.description: Maximum allowed height of the vessel in cm when the object is operable and open.

max_length_cm.description: Maximum allowed length of the vessel in cm as given in legal regulations. This shall be a fall-back default value for all ship categories, if no Sailing Dimensions table is provided.

max_width_cm.description: Maximum allowed width of the vessel in cm as given in legal regulations. This shall be a fall-back default value for all ship categories, if no Sailing Dimensions table is provided

min_draught_cm.description: Minimum allowed draught of the vessel in cm.

min_height_cm.description: Minimum allowed height of the vessel in cm.

min_length_cm.description: Minimum allowed length of the vessel in cm.

min_width_cm.description: Minimum allowed width of the vessel in cm.

network_section_ref.description: RIS_ID of the network section the object lies on.

object_ref.description: RIS_ID of the already existing related object in RIS.net

object_reference_code.description: Object Reference Code, if needed for Electronic Reporting purposes.

object_type.description: Entity type name of the referenced object, e.g. distance_mark, berth, marina, harbour, harbour_basin, port, terminal

operation_mode.description: Operational mode an object may be passed by a vessel. Allowed values: 1 (Passable, requiring operation), 2 (Passable, no operation required), 3 (Not passable).

operation_type.description: How the object is operated. Allowed values: 0 (Local Operation), 1 (Remote Operation), 2 (Self-Service), 3 (Automatic), 4 (not applicable), null (unknown)

orient.description: Orientation of the object in degrees (0 = north) for map presentation.

pass_duration_minute.description: Average passage duration in minutes, if the object is operable . ETD = ETA + pass_duration_minute

port_ref.description: RIS_ID of the Port object the object may belong to.

position.description: Position of the gate if it belongs to a lock. Allowed values: UPS (upstream), MI (middle), DWN (downstream)

private_status.description: Public/private status of the object. Allowed values: 1 (public), 2 (private), 3 (unknown).

safety_margin_cm.description: Safety margin in cm to be subtracted for calculation of actual clearance height.

ship_category.description: Allowed vessel types. Allowed values are defined in the spreadsheet 'Shipcategory'. Recommended Values: 10000 (Sea), 32000 (Cargo), 31000 (Passenger), 20000 (Recreational crafts), 21000 (sail), 22000 (motorized).

strategic_point_type.description: Type of priority applying for the strategic point. Allowed values: 0 (not applicable), 1 (Voyage description + ETA), 2 (ETA calculation), 3 (ERI related + ETA)

supplies.description: Available supplies. Allowed values: 1 (drinking water), 2 (electrical power), 3 (fuel), 4 (put car ashore), 5 (bilge water disposal), 6 (paper waste disposal), 7 (plastic waste disposal), 8 (glass waste disposal), 9 (residual waste disposal), 10 (oil waste disposal), 11 (organic waste disposal), 12 (dangerous waste disposal), 13 (sewage water disposal)

tentec.description: Indicates whether the network section is part of the TENtec network or not, and if this is the country 'providing' the info. true = Network Section is part of the TENtec Network. false = Network Section is not part of the TENtec Network

un_locode.description: 5-Digit UN Location Code in which the object lies. The first two digits specify the country.

un_loname.description: Location name according to the UN: name of city or municipality in national language (see instructions at https://service.unece.org/trade/locode/Service/LocodeColumn.htm#Name).

up_fairway_km.description: Fairway km of the upstream node, by which the network section is formed and connected to others.

vertical_clearance_datum.description: Type of the Waterlevel reference height (CM).

vertical_clearance_val_cm.description: Waterlevel reference height based on the reference code (see HEIGHT_REF) (CM).
